attributes.action: Stop patients having to wait in corridors to be seen by medical staff.
attributes.additional_details:
Because people are effectively dying. Not treating people immediately or then waiting on a corridor is a disgrace to there privacy and health concerns while sharing said corridor with others. Stop paying top dollar to the own pushers and get the medical
Staff paid correctly and distributed to hospitals in need. No one should have to wait like they are. Patients shouldn’t have to die because of the neglect from government to the NHS. We all can’t afford private medical care.
attributes.background: STOP all these patients suffering in corridors in hospitals waiting to see medical staff. Ensure there’s enough staff to patient ratio, STOP blaming covid, it’s been happening long before this. Ensure all cancer patients are seen and given treatment regardless of lockdowns!

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local NHS services are a matter for individual Clinical Commissioning Groups (CCGs) and NHS facilities, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

We could accept a petition calling on the Government to increase NHS funding to increase capacity, if that's what you want to happen.

You have the right to make a complaint about any aspect of NHS care, treatment or service. If you would like to complain to the NHS you can find out how to do so here: https://www.nhs.uk/using-the-nhs/about-the-nhs/how-to-complain-to-the-nhs/
